For the longest time, Sutro Elementary School playground has been separated from the campus buildings by a lawn. In the nice and sunny months, the walk down to the playground is no issue, but any kind of moisture or precipitation makes for a messy journey to and from the playground. In addition, because the lawn leading to the playground lies on a slope, it makes for a difficult journey for any students requiring ADA accommodations.

On October 31, 2019, LCSD maintenance crews were up before the sun to lay the concrete for the new sidewalk. On November 5, 2019, Sutro Elementary held a ribbon cutting ceremony in which one of their students who will greatly benefit from the sidewalk, Journey, was able to cut the ribbon with her classmates. This is a wonderful improvement both for all students, staff and visitors to the Sutro playground.

"Thank you to LCSD facilities crew for making this a reality!" - Sutro Elementary School @ Sutro Elementary School

PRECAUTIONARY Lock-In at DES, DIS and DHS.

Thanks for bearing with us. Below is our official press release regarding the incident.

In the Dayton area near Dayton Elementary, Intermediate and High schools, it was reported to Lyon County Sheriff‚Äôs Office and school administration that there was an individual seen at the park across the street with a firearm. School administration immediately implemented a precautionary lock-in at all three schools and were in communication with local law enforcement who were working diligently to investigate the allegation. Shortly after, the three schools received the all-clear from LCSO and the lock-in was lifted. School operations have proceeded as normal with all students and staff safe and secure. The investigation revealed that the individual suspected with a firearm was a Lyon County employee with a pellet gun attempting to address a squirrel issue at the park. At no time were students or staff in any danger.

Official Statement regarding Fernley High School:

This morning at Fernley High School a student reported to administration that they believed another student was going to shoot up the school during the morning assembly. School administration immediately contacted law enforcement and found that they had already received the tip and thoroughly investigated it the night before. Law enforcement and school administration found absolutely no credibility to the allegations. As a result of the prompt actions of law enforcement, school operations have proceeded as normal with all students and staff safe and secure. We commend school officials, law enforcement and our students for being so diligent in reporting and investigating suspected issues. We encourage families to speak with their children about the importance of reporting suspected issues and also the dangers of false threats or information.
